result.execSummary:
The defendant Murad S Alhakimi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC (>2500-10,000 g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse program after serving one half (1/2) Initial Confinement.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges  including the mandatory DNA surcharge within term of probation.  If revoked, to be collected by DOC of out of 25% prison wages. Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Seek and maintain full time employment.

Defendant to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.

No positive results.
No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.  Absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
Huber privileges for work and treatment.
After serving four (4) months of huber release,  Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Murad S Alhakimi

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Murad S Alhakimi in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI addressed; correction made.   


  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 5 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 3 years with credit for 1 day 
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.


The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3
years with the following conditions:

*Serve condition time of 8 months in the HOC, Huber privileges for work and treatment.  After serving 4 months of Huber release, court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*Absolute sobriety.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within term of probation.  IF REVOKED, to be collected by DOC of out of 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.  
- IF REVOKED:  Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1/2 initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Murad S Alhakimi in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    PSI ordered.
Defendant Murad S Alhakimi in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Murad S Alhakimi in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON FEBRUARY 27, 2014. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Court ordered no possession or use of NO DRUGS.

Defendant Murad S Alhakimi in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/26/14 @ 1:30pm
